body.p: This manual uses these type conventions:
body.note: Some conventions only apply to display screens (if installed).

li.p: Bold type highlights important concepts in discussions, key terms in procedures, and menu options, or represents a command or option that you type or enter at a prompt.
Italic type highlights notes and new terms where they are defined.
Screen type represents information that appears on the screen or LCD.

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22033 0000012241_P-164001115 Aggregator Reactor (2500A) Installation Manual\Graphics\note_color.eps

row.entry: Information notes call attention to important features or instructions.
Brackets are used when referring to a specific key, such as [Enter] or [Ctrl].
